reviews.text: I absolutely love Mocha Cabana. Really great food and friendly service. Lots of options for those with dietary restrictions as well. The patio is sheltered in the back of the restaurant which makes it really nice even on windy days (which seem to frequent this place). Would recommend trying out.

The food was fantastic, I had the Fettuccine Alfredo and the experience was similar to the scene in Ratatouille where the critic eats the food and thinks of his childhood. There's a homeless shelter next door however so the street is a little full of shady types and a drunk  homeless person had to be removed from the restaurant. So if your willing to take a chance at your car being broken into while you enjoy a fantastic meal then I highly recommend it.
My favourite veggie burger around. The beverages are delicious as well. I come here pretty frequently and the only thing is sometimes the service is a miss. Otherwise, great little restaurant.

The environment of this place nice.They have a great variety of foods to choose from and people are friendly.

Oh some of the best cheese cake with fun flavours. I love that they support local.  Me being someone with a sweet tooth dessert is a must, However I found their portion size of the cheese cake slice to be much smaller than usual. I only discovered this when I got them back home, if I knew the portion size maybe I would have bought more pieces!! This is modern day cost cutting for you, I would not mind paying extra to get my fill!

Such a great little place to check out when you tire of the usual food fare; the prices match the quality of the food and the atmosphere is welcoming. Friday nights they play music, Sunday brunch is the best.

The restaurant itself is cozy and warm. All of the pictures on the wall remind me of Satdi's restaurants in Chicago. I am told all the famous pictures are at the owner's friends and people who have eaten here. The picture over our table is one of the late and great Prince. I had the opportunity to cook for him for 2 weeks.  The lights hanging in the middle of the restaurant reminds me of our flat we had for a week in Chicago.

My husband and I have been dining at Coco Pazzo for more than 20 years.  Their service at every level is a rare combination of highly professional and personally welcoming.  Every course and every choice is exceptionally well-prepared.  Their wine choices and recommendations are outstanding.  We highly recommend Coco Pazzo as a great value for an excellent dining experience.  John & Mary Galati

Good location, less crowded. Place is right upstairs through the entrance doors. Greeted to be seated.

Seating arrangement is fine. Tables seem fairly well spaced so it does not seem crowded. There is a water table that is kind of next to some tables so some people may find that intrusive as many busboys will crowd there.

Food selection was good. Lots of pasta options. Less so on salads and appetizers. 

There is a wine menu but no drink menu.
Great atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious authentic pasta. There are a ton if Italian restaurants in Chicago and I've been to many.  Coco Pazzo is definitely in the top 10.
The papadelle in wild boar ragu was absolutely amazing!  Great service too and very nice Italian wine list.  I just wish they had half bottles for someone like me who travels a lot and dines alone...

A great place for dinner. Went for a family dinner, late evening on a Saturday. As expected there was a wide range of patrons from quiet couples, to younger groups priming up for the club scene to families like myself. The staff handled the diverse crowd amazingly. Our food was typical Earls quality, so fantastic comfort food and having a modest selection of craft beer on tap was an added bonus. I'll be back again and again.

Food is always great at Earls. The only reason I didn't give full stars for this particular Earls, was the person who showed us to our table. She was super unfriendly, barely said 2 words to us, and didn't smile at all. Our server, however, was awesome! It's a neat place for sure.
Can't go wrong with Earl's!!! Late lunch & happy hour menu 3pm-6pm!!! Quick & friendly service & amazing mountain views. The patio will be so popular come Sumner time

My friends and I are from out of town. We were told that Earls was a super great place to go so we decided to taxi over for some drinks. Hi balls were cheap which was nice but the service sucked, Took forever to get our drinks and shots and for our waiter to come see if we needed or wanted anything else. They were only giving attention to what looked like to be the locals, as there were hugging them and standing at the tables and holding conversations.
Average Earl's experience. The service was great, however my food tased like the deep fryers hadn't been changed in months. The patio looked nice, it was too chilly that evening to sit out there.

I am not quite sure what it's meant to be, but its not Mexican food, 100%. We give it a shot cuz it was closer to our hotel. The ingredients are different as is the flavour compared to real Mexican cuisine. It's like a Latino place yes, but not Mexican, the rice was plain, the enchiladas and the tortillas bland and tasteless, like soggy reheat tortillas, far from what we expected on entering as the look and feel is not too bad, but, the food, well, honestly, it's poor. I know it because I'm Mexican!! Is a shame because I was very excited to try some Mexican food but nothing like a real one.

Best Mexican food around here. Southern California is the only place to find places like this. Good Mexican food and nice staff. If you like Mexican it is worth your while to give these guys a try. I eat here just a few times a year to get the Mexican food experience. Regards
Absolutely love this place. It is the BEST mexican cuisine in all of Lethbridge. Always large portions for a good price

Awful experience. My veggie fajitas were nothing but a couple tortillas and platter of frozen veggie mix, mostly cauliflower, broccoli, cabbage and carrots. I had asked the waitress why these fajitas weren't with peppers and onion (like the chicken and beef fajitas were with) and when she got the cook to come out, the cook pointed at one onion and one sliver of a bell pepper and that was supposed to be sufficient. I double checked and my meal also included a side of guacamole and when I didn't get that and asked, the waitress told me yes it comes with meal and is included in the price but they do not serve it unless the customer asks for it. Will never go back to this establishment. Worst meal I've ever had .
Amazing Mexican food. Good place for a group gathering or just a solo lunch. Good stuff

Had the super buffet and for 20 bucks it's pretty good food. I get full quick but I managed to scarf down two full plates before I couldn't eat any more. Would definitely recommend if you wanted Chinese food by yourself or as a small group. Small shop but very nice.
Great place! Buffet is always full and fresh! Great staff. Parking lot is very full at supper time. My favourite Chinese food in Lethbridge.

Very good food and very attentive staff. Went for supper buffet and there is a  wide variety of food choices. I have been there a few times so the waitresses talk to me using my first name. Order take out a lot from there too.
Awsome food. Always fresh. They cook in small batches so when they bring out the food it always is fresh. Very good.

Typical Lethbridge. Might as well go to the mall for Chinese food. At least their rice is actually fried. Best part was the pre-made cheese cake cubes. I'll will say their stragely shaped pork had some good sauce. Utterly underwhelmed.
This is the place that was closed down by the health inspectors.

Excellent food. Nice rustic atmosphere. The exceptional staff here, in particular Amy and Tina, took care of our group extremely well despite a crowd of people who all needed to be seated or served. They kept their humor and professionalism despite the stress of a peak period. My fajitas were superb and the beef ribs stellar. Highly recommended.

Will not be back. We asked what the drink special was neither of the staff members knew. We overheard the table next to us who were looking for their forgotten drink, and complaining of an overcooked steak. Once our server came we ordered Caesars (which were the special) and he seemed to not even know what we were ordering, then when they came, one was without the topping, the other was completely watered down, worst Caesar ever. My friends steak sandwich was well done when we ordered it medium rare. An overall not enjoyable experience.

Service was really good, food was good. Kids meals are generous, but a little pricey. This is a casual dining place. The servers wear plaid shirts like they are from Montana, which is strange for a restaurant that is only in Canada. Mostly BBQ fare which is done half decent. It is a chain restaurant, so I'm pretty sure they don't have a smoker out back, but get some of their food pre-smoked/cooked. Unique cabin like relaxed atmosphere, good food and we had excellent service from Hector. I'm sure we will be back. Thanks

Was told a 10-15 min wait.  A lot of open tables.  Said that there was alot of reservations.  Asked if we could sit in the lounge.  No. Waited and waited. Then after time went by. A nice fellow asked if we had been helped. My company asked if we could sit in the lounge as we were told previously - NO!  
He awkwardly asked the hostess if we could she nodded her head yes without even looking at any of us. The lounge had lots of tables too. Our server was somewhat nice but made us feel like we were bothering her. 
The only time that was comfortable is when I brought up how nice the wet napkins were.  Then her natural personality came out. 
Won't be going there for a extremely long period of time if again.
I was at montana's march 21st and had a great experience.... the service was great and the food even better. Great place for a party

If you got a lot of people and have $13 per person, I recommend the lunch buffet. Its got good price for the quantity you get. I recommend small sample portions to find your preference. Their supper buffet cost about $20 and has stuff you don't normally see at their lunch buffet. They do occasionally change some of the items at their lunch buffet just not often. Water is free. Any other drink isn't but they do have good drinks if your feeling adventurous. Things to note, marble tabletops, spacious dining room, friendly staff, clean renovated washrooms. My recommendation for ordering something is the Chef's Lo Mein.

I will always come here for Chinese food! Their staff treats my family like their family, the food is good, expensive a little, but definitely worth it. The restaurant is clean and very beautiful! It's always a pleasure to come here!!

Terrible foods. We order dinner for three. Says chicken fried noodles, chicken fried rice and deep fried shrimps and chicken. The noodles were very soft. I don't know what kind of noodle was. Both noodles and rice has no flavour what so ever.  The other deep fried food had too much flours outside coating. They are no Chinese food taste at all.
Excellent service... the food was very nice and decent price. I have chicken fried rice and it was a massive plate I couldn't finish the whole dish...

Buffet was small for lunch. And awesome ginger beef was awesome. Everything g else was ok.

Place wax clean and staff inviting.

This restaurant reinforces my belief that many of the best restaurants are the little “hole in the wall” places. Not a very big restaurant in a nondescript strip of stores and restaurants, but great, flavourful food served in generous portions, at reasonable prices. Their beef rice vermicelli soup had an excellent broth, perfectly cooked noodles, and a decent portion of beef. They have a Monday special on spring rolls, at $1.50 each and they’re both really good and really large. This place became our go-to Vietnamese place in one visit.

Lunch specials are fantastic, or try the sizzling hot plates. Good friendly service and great portion sizes. If you are craving spring rolls, these are the best in Lethbridge and they’re half price on Monday’s!!
Always awesome food! It’s ready super fast too. Friendly staff!
We made plans at the last minute and showed up with a group of 11 without a reservation. The servers weren't even fazed. The service was quick and friendly and our food came out super fast too!
always a great experience here. food is good every time I'm there

If you got a lot of people and have $13 per person, I recommend the lunch buffet. Its got good price for the quantity you get. I recommend small sample portions to find your preference. Their supper buffet cost about $20 and has stuff you don't normally see at their lunch buffet. They do occasionally change some of the items at their lunch buffet just not often. Water is free. Any other drink isn't but they do have good drinks if your feeling adventurous. Things to note, marble tabletops, spacious dining room, friendly staff, clean renovated washrooms. My recommendation for ordering something is the Chef's Lo Mein.

I will always come here for Chinese food! Their staff treats my family like their family, the food is good, expensive a little, but definitely worth it. The restaurant is clean and very beautiful! It's always a pleasure to come here!!

Terrible foods. We order dinner for three. Says chicken fried noodles, chicken fried rice and deep fried shrimps and chicken. The noodles were very soft. I don't know what kind of noodle was. Both noodles and rice has no flavour what so ever.  The other deep fried food had too much flours outside coating. They are no Chinese food taste at all.
Excellent service... the food was very nice and decent price. I have chicken fried rice and it was a massive plate I couldn't finish the whole dish...

Buffet was small for lunch. And awesome ginger beef was awesome. Everything g else was ok.

Place wax clean and staff inviting.

We love this restaurant! We have tried other Vietnamese places and this one is by far the best. The staff is so friendly. The food is amazing, it definitely has the umami factor. Their charbroiled pork is the best! I also love their Tom Yum Soup! I highly recommend this restaurant. Dinner is great there. Lunch is busy but they have Vietnamese subs, yummy!

The restaurants very clean on the outside and its staff is very friendly I personally love their beef stew get it every time I go there I've also had their rare beef Pho which is really good my wife likes the curry shrimp all in all this is a pretty good restaurant. best Vietnamese in south Lethbridge that I've tried

The curry beef is the only thing I get here. I usually tell them extra spicy. It's funny because I myself am a very thirsty person when going out, and I really like ice tea. There is a waitress that normally serves us there. The last time we were there she was serving other people. She saw that we came in and knew that the person serving us will have to run back and fourth a few times. Every time she serves us she just brings a jug of ice tea right off the bat. It's even more funnier when they load it up with ice. That means they need to go back and fourth even more.
My favourite Saigonese restaurant! Come here regularly. Highly recommend

Me and my girlfriend always come here! The pho is amazing, and the complementary bean sprouts add to any dish. My glass is always full of cold water and the service is great, usually get checked on 2-3 times.  Bathrooms are clean, sometimes it’s a wait if the place is really busy. I’ve never had a bad experience here!!

Love this place.. Tons of food for the price.. Is tasty and the staff are very friendly. One staff member.. Might be the owner? Actually fermented me from a couple months ago which makes me feel like they care. Great place.
Tasty food, reasonable prices, generous portions and great service. We ordered 22 (spicy) and 33 on the menu , and they were both great . Highly recommend
Blech. Lemongrass chicken tasted microwaved. And way. Too. Much. Cilantro.
Nice atmosphere. Good food. Fair prices.
Always delish!  Have the no. 33 with peanut sauce! 👍

Had a family birthday gathering here. The staff was amazing catering to our many needs. We were a group of about 30 ages from 0-70+. Fantastic service and fabulous meal. Highly recommended  by  all of us.

I visited tony romas for a steak. The meal was very good and so was the service. The manager introduced himself to the customers welcoming everyone I thought was very nice of him. I highly recommend this restaurant for a high quality meal and for socializing it has a good relaxing quiet atmosphere. I will be returning again very soon.
Had the lunch burger, it was pretty good. Service was good, staff were friendly. I noticed that the lunch menu increased in price - that was a bummer. $13 for a burger?! highway robbery! ;-)

Lethbridge's best statehouse! In a landscape of top price Dinning, you can't get better then Toni Roma's. The food is all great. The portions are very good. Whenever we can, about once in two or three months, my wife and myself splurge and go to Tony Roma's.

Oh... WOW. Great service. LOVE the hostess, Brenna. Excellent costumer service and politeness from her. And the server, PARIS! Outstanding service, best waitress we’ve ever had. The manager, Kacie, was very kind and very welcoming. The food was just amazing. The atmosphere of the restaurant was very warming. Will definitely be visiting again :)

Lovely service. Had the hot bar Sunday am & the frittata was so delicious! Coffee was so delicious.  Used a card & couldn't leave a tip but I was really happy with the service & self serve amenities.  Definitely will be back.
Their bowl of soup is excellent and reasonably priced. Comes with a slice of bread. Best deal in town.
Very kind staff and great coffee and food. Nice atmosphere too.

I enjoy coming here on a Sunday after my yoga class for a matcha latte and a lemon cranberry muffin. I highly recommend both food items. I removed a star because there is only one person working there and while he's nice, he isn't fast and efficient with taking and producing orders. When the line gets long, expect an even longer wait.
Was just there today, (warm,  not hot) mocha expresso was good. I like.  I noticed people from varying age groups.  I am currently not a member of the Co op.  Hope to join
